page.title: 11GENERAL REVIEW
page.content: Woburn Sands lies on the Bucks. border and is an ecclesiastical parish formed in l867. Aspley Heath is part of Woburn Sands and is a civil parish created in 1883.The area now has representation on Milton Keynes Borough Council. The village is built on Greensand and Oxford Clay which runs across the village. The area is heavily wooded, mainly with conifers, resulting from the making good of ground excavated in the extraction of Fullers Earth. The rest of the area is divided into two categories, residential and agricultural.Communications are good, there being easy access to the M1 motorway and to the local railway line between Bedford and Bletchley. At the present time bus services connect the village with nearby towns.
